titles.title: Immediate Financial Assistance for America's Seniors Act of 2008
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide recovery rebates to certain individuals receiving social security benefits.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

term.name: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

bill.summary: 1/29/2008--Introduced. Immediate Financial Assistance for America's Seniors Act of 2008 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow social security recipients with earned income less than $3,000 a $300 refundable tax credit ($600 for married couples filing a joint tax return) in 2008. Reduces the amount of such credit by 5% of the amount by which the taxpayer's adjusted gross income exceeds $75,000.
